title: Here’s who will be on the ballot for November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Incumbent Ruthzee Louijeune leads at-large city councilor race with 17.65% of votes in the preliminary election.
Gabriela Coletta Zapata dominates District 1 council race, securing 76.96% of votes for the November ballot.
District 7 council race remains tight with Mavrick Afonso slightly ahead, holding 15.45% of preliminary votes.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu leads preliminary election by over 45 percentage points against challenger Josh Kraft.
Josh Kraft vows to continue his mayoral campaign despite the significant loss to Wu in preliminary voting.
Preliminary election saw nearly 18% voter turnout with over 75,000 ballots cast, according to Boston Elections Department.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Cindy Bi, a San Francisco venture capitalist, sued surrogate 'Rebecca Smith' after a miscarriage, accusing her of negligence.
Smith signed with a respected agency for surrogacy, but tensions with Bi escalated due to numerous demands and social media posts.
Bi allegedly harassed Smith post-miscarriage, leading Smith to change jobs and relocate after Bi's negative social media campaign.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns to the Bruins' training camp fully recovered from a fractured patella that sidelined him last season.
Lindholm aims to bolster the Bruins' defense and power play, crucial after the team struggled with a 33-39-10 record last season.
Lindholm's return is expected to enhance the Bruins' power play, improving from a 29th-ranked 15.2% success rate last season.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bills QB Josh Allen praises Patriots QB Drake Maye as bright and authentic during a podcast appearance.
Josh Allen compares Drake Maye's development to his own, noting both share arm strength and scrambling ability.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards with one touchdown and interception in the Patriots' loss to the Raiders.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: The MBTA introduced a maroon and yellow train commemorating the Boston and Maine Railroad on the Commuter Rail this week.
Two additional trains honoring New Haven and New York Central Railroads will be introduced by the end of the year.
The refurbished trains include modern upgrades like remote monitoring and new brake and control systems, according to the MBTA.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Former Patriots lineman Cole Strange joins Miami Dolphins ahead of Sundayâ€™s game against New England.
Strange was picked 29th overall by the Patriots in 2022 but struggled with injuries and performance.
The Dolphins signed Strange from Cleveland's practice squad after a Week 1 injury to James Daniels.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Starting next fall, Tufts University will offer free tuition to undergraduates from families earning less than $150,000 annually.
Families earning less than $60,000 will receive a financial aid package without student loans, meeting their full financial need.
The initiative aims to increase diversity and follows other New England universities offering similar tuition-free programs based on income.

title: Aunt now caring for young daughter of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: David Minasvand, 31, killed Nadia Abrahamian, 80, and Karine Asatryan, 35, in a Watertown murder-suicide, officials confirm.
The 1-year-old daughter of the victims, Madeline, will be cared for by her aunt following the tragedy.
Over $37,000 has been raised through a fundraiser to support Madeline's upbringing and future needs.

title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins GM Don Sweeney expresses confidence in the team's competitiveness for the 2025-26 season despite last year's challenges.
Sweeney highlights an opportunity for younger players to secure roles, amid new free-agent additions to the Bruins roster.
No captain has been named yet; Bruins start season letting leadership emerge organically, with candidates like Pastrnak and McAvoy.
